headline.print_headline: Out of Hand, in a Snap

headline.main: Heat Beat Celtics to Reach N.B.A. Finals

docs.snippet: Miami’s Big Three was better than Boston’s, and the Heat reached the finals for the second straight year. This time, they will play the Oklahoma City Thunder for the championship....
docs.abstract: Miami Heat overwhelm the Boston Celtics, 101-88, to win Game 7 of the NBA Eastern Conference finals and take the series four games to three.
docs.lead_paragraph: Miami’s Big Three was better than Boston’s, and the Heat reached the finals for the second straight year. This time, they will play the Oklahoma City Thunder for the championship.

headline.print_headline: Assad’s Response to Syria Unrest Leaves His Own Sect Divided
headline.seo: Syrian Alawites Divided by Assad’s Response to Unrest
headline.main: Assad’s Response to Syria Unrest Leaves His Own Sect Divided

docs.snippet: Some Alawites have been frustrated that security forces have not crushed the opposition, while others say President Bashar al-Assad is pushing the sect to the brink of civil war with Sunni Muslims....

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Pres Bashar al-Assad of Syria has increasingly relied on his fellow Alawite Muslims for support as sectarian strife escalates in the country, but interviews reveal a growing rift within that religious community; some Alawites are frustrated that security forces have not yet managed to crush the opposition, while others feel Assad is risking the future of the Alawites by pushing them to the brink of civil war with Sunni Muslims.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, and an employee of The New York Times from Damascus, Syria.

docs.lead_paragraph: Some Alawites have been frustrated that security forces have not crushed the opposition, while others say President Bashar al-Assad is pushing the sect to the brink of civil war with Sunni Muslims.
